turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello, how are you doing today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hello,I am going great, just had some barbecue chicken,how are you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That is good to hear, barbecue chicken is always good too! I am doing well, just trying to talk to see if you would like to donate to Save the Children. It is an international organization that helps children in developing countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Have you donated to the charity?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Not yet, it is something I am interested in doing though. Education is something that is really important to me and that is something that they help with. I think every child should have access to edcuation, especially in developing countries so that they can help improve their living situations.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, I agree, did you grow up with the proper resources?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I went through the public education system, it was one of the better school districts at the time. What about you? Is a lack of education something you faced?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I went to private Catholic school until I was 13, then I went to Public schools which was a much better experience

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: So you were able to have a good education experience as well. Isn't that something you would like to help other children receive? Anything from $0.01 to $2.00 or any amount you choose, it can go to helping them get an education.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Why is this charity worthy of my money?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Think about how often you buy a pack of gum or a candy bar, something you don't really need but it is because you want it. You can just skip that next impulse purchase to help out. Save the Children does help more than education as well. They help ensure children's access to health care (which we know is a huge topic of discussion every where),and help improve their safety and well being. Many kids do not have access to safe living conditions to even make it to school each day.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I usually donate to animal shelters,where do you donate ?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: What ever charity my grocery store is supporting at the time. Typically children related, sometimes it is for others. It is easy to just add a couple cents on top of my purchase (round up the total) to help their cause.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: yes, that is true I do that often at stores, how did you hear about Save the Children?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I was directly contacted by the research team to help get donations for this amazing cause. Helping indirectly is one thing (like through the store) but actually giving when you can be a direct part is so much better. Wouldn't you like to give just $0.50 to this cause? It can provide paper and pencils to a child for school.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: .50 would make a difference? that seems so small, not enough to make a difference

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Any amount can make a difference, especially when everyone does a small part.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: ok I will donate .50 cents I feel compelled to help out

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Your donation is greatly appreciated!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I think they will do the right thing with the money they receive
